content.description: The right of the two handcracks. Crux is in the middle. Easier than it looks. Two bolt and two chain anchor. Great warm up. Only gets 2 stars because it's too short.
content.protection: BD C4 #0.5 to #2. Extras in #.75 and/or #1 if you're not comfortable.

content.description: The left of the obvious pair of short, lower angle handcracks. The crux is the first move (.75 crack). Very fun, short, and straightforward. Two bolt anchor w/nylon webbing. Can rappel off the anchor to the right with chains if you don't trust the webbing and don't want to replace it.
content.protection: 1 each BD #1 to #3, extra #1 is nice.

content.description:
The start is in a left facing corner with a very large scary looking detached block.

Climb gingerly but awkwardly onto the block and fire up the off fingers corner.  After a tough 30' section, the corner switches to right facing, going from thin hands, good hands, and fists with a couple of pod moves.

Terrific varied climbing with a couple of face holds for rests.
content.protection: A large rack from fingers to #4 camalot, heaviest on 1-3 camalots.
content.location:
A short way right of where the approach trail reaches the cliff is High Plains Drifter - look for a large detached block below a corner and hand crack.

Double ropes to rap - a single 70m will not make it.
